questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the Oxford comma?

choices.answer: They were, red, blue and green.
They were red blue and, green.
They were red, blue, and green.
They were red, blue and green.

questions.question: Which is the correct use of a semicolon?

choices.answer: Canada is beautiful; so many impressive boats.
I swear I saw a rabbit; bear; or mouse downstairs.
Earth is old; it formed 4.5 billion years ago.
I laughed; loudly.

questions.question: Which use of a colon is incorrect?

choices.answer: I have to get surgery on my arm: I fell out of a tree.
She had doctorates in two areas: philosophy and physics.
I knew exactly what I wanted: pizza.
She said :stop running!:

questions.question: Which is the correct use of an en dash?

choices.answer: I promised–well, sorta–that we’d go.
I’ve told you a million–times, no.
The Chicago–New York flight left at 6:00.
Don’t go–I’ll make dinner.

questions.question: Which is the correct use of an em dash?

choices.answer: The dinner is from 6:00—9:00.
She said, —sometimes I wish I had a cat.
No—way, did she really say that?
I went to the movies—despite having homework—and saw Jaws.

questions.question: Which is the correct use of parentheses?

choices.answer: His name is Alexander (Alex for short).
Why do cats (meow) and dogs (woof)?
We flew (I’m craving pizza) overseas.
None of these are correct.

questions.question: Which is the correct use of an ellipsis?

choices.answer: “Don’t do it”…she said.
I wonder if… Oh, never mind.
I thought you knew…she’s going to be okay.
All of these are correct.

questions.question: Which correctly uses a period/full stop?

choices.answer: The store had mangoes, apples, kiwis, etc.
The store had mangoes, apples, kiwis, etc..

questions.question: Fill in the blank: This old thing? ___ broken!

choices.answer: Its
It’s

questions.question: Which of these is a type of interrobang?
